content: v formation instructions cast on 132 stitches with us3 place a beginning of the round marker hat will be worked in the round joining in first round work a k2 p2 rib for 1 5 inches change to a us5 and begin cable pattern cable pattern round 1 knit materials round 2 knit round 3 knit yarns 1 skein juniper moon farms round 4 c6f k6 to end of round herriot 218yds/100g round 5 knit needles us3 & us5 16 circular & dpns round 6 knit notions stitch marker & tapestry needle round 7 knit gauge 1 cable repeat of 12 sts = 1 5 in round 8 k6 c6b to end of round abbreviations repeat above 8 rounds 4 more times ending after working a round 8 k=knit decrease crown of hat p=purl round 1 k4 k2tog k6 to end of round 121 stitches c6f= slip next 3 stitches to a cable round 2 knit needle & hold in front knit next 3 round 3 k3 k2tog k6 to end of round 110 stitches stitches knit 3 stitches from cable needle round 4 c4f k6 to end of round c6b= slip next 3 stitches to a cable round 5 k4 ssk k4 to end of round 99 stitches needle & hold in back knit next 3 round 6 knit stitches knit 3 stitches from cable needle round 7 k4 ssk k3 to end of round 88 stitches k2tog= knit next 2 stitches together round 8 k4 c4b to end of round ssk= slip 2 stitches knitwise 1 at a time round 9 k2 k2tog k4 to end of round 77 stitches to right needle put the left needle into the round 10 knit 2 stitches and knit them together round 11 k1 k2tog k4 to end of round 66 stitches c4f= slip next 2 stitches to a cable round 12 c2f k4 to end of round needle & hold in front knit next 2 stitches knit 2 stitches from cable needle round 13 k2 ssk k2 to end of round 55 stitches c4b= slip next 2 stitches to a cable round 14 knit needle & hold in back knit next 2 round 15 k2 ssk k1 to end of round 44 stitches stitches knit 2 stitches from cable needle round 16 k2tog to end of round 22 stitches c2f= slip next 1 stitch to a cable needle & break yarn weave yarn through remaining stitches with a tapestry hold in front knit next stitch knit 1 needle cinch and weave in the end add your pom pom stitch from cable needle we can learn a lot about teamwork and cooperation from geese flying in v-formation the lead goose uses the most energy because it i s the first to break up the flow of air to give additional lift to the geese behind when the lead goose gets tired it goes to the back of t he v where the wind is lightest and another goose moves to the
